definition: constant (math.)/quota/fixed number (e.g. of places on a bus)/fixed quantity (e.g. load of truck)/destiny
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: The rent was fifty-five dollars, with clothes and extras a varying sum.
sentences.chinese: 房租是五十五元，衣服和零用沒有定數。

sentences.english: There's a lot of volatility in exchange rates.
sentences.chinese: 匯率的波動毫無定數可言。

sentences.english: He believes that everybody's life is predestined.
sentences.chinese: 認爲人生禍福早有定數。

sentences.english: There are many life destiny, unanticipated at the time the board had already set up.
sentences.chinese: 生命裏有很多定數，在未曾預料的時候就已擺好了局。

sentences.english: The instrument has an ability of preselecring a setpoint, when the setpoint is reached, it will automatically give out a signal.
sentences.chinese: 它具有預先定數功能，當計滿定數後自動發出信號。

sentences.english: The instrument has an ability of preselecring a setpoint, when the setpoint is reached, it will automatically give out a signal.
sentences.chinese: 它具有預先定數功能，當計滿定數後自動發出信號。

sentences.english: Life, there are many set number of unexpected had arranged the Bureau.
sentences.chinese: 生命裏有很多定數，在未曾預料的時候就已擺好了局。

definition: all one's hopes and efforts come to nothing/futile
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
to satisfy both sides/to accommodate both (demands)
